item.title: Slow thinking about small samples.
item.description: 1 Small samples are more extreme 2 Funnel plots to the rescue 3 Stats as slow thinking div#TOC li { list-style:none; background-image:none; background-repeat:none; background-position:0; } In 2006, the statistician Howard Wainer and the education researcher Harris Zwerling wrote a short research paper about school size. In it they present two facts about the rate of Kidney Cancer in counties in the US. Do me the favour of thinking about how you would explain each of them.
